unnormalised: In yesterday's IPL match, CSK scored 188/6 in their 20 overs, while MI managed only 170/8. This marks CSK's 5th win of the season, placing them at #3 on the points table with a Net Run Rate (NRR) of +0.550.
normalised: In yesterday's I-P-L match, C-S-K scored one hundred and eighty eight for six in their twenty overs, while M-I managed only one hundred and seventy for eight. This marks C-S-K's fifth win of the season, placing them at hash three on the points table with a Net Run Rate (N-R-R) of positive zero point five five zero.

unnormalised: Breaking down the scores, Ruturaj Gaikwad hit a brilliant 75 off 50 balls, including 8 fours and 3 sixes. Shivam Dube contributed a quickfire 35 from just 20 balls. For MI, Rohit Sharma scored 48, but it wasn't enough to chase down the target. The highest strike rate of the match was Nicholas Pooran at 210.
normalised: Breaking down the scores, Ruturaj Gaikwad hit a brilliant seventy five off fifty balls, including eight fours and three sixes. Shivam Dube contributed a quickfire thirty five from just twenty balls. For M-I, Rohit Sharma scored forty eight, but it wasn't enough to chase down the target. The highest strike rate of the match was Nicholas Pooran at two hundred and ten.

unnormalised: The match also saw some interesting bowling figures. Matheesha Pathirana took 2 wickets for 30 runs in his 4 overs, with an economy rate of 7.5. Jasprit Bumrah, on the other hand, bowled economically, giving away only 25 runs in his 4 overs but picking up only 1 wicket. The average score in the last 5 matches at Wankhede Stadium has been 165.
normalised: The match also saw some interesting bowling figures. Matheesha Pathirana took two wickets for thirty runs in his four overs, with an economy rate of seven point five. Jasprit Bumrah, on the other hand, bowled economically, giving away only twenty five runs in his four overs but picking up only one wicket. The average score in the last five matches at Wankhede Stadium has been one hundred and sixty five.

unnormalised: Looking ahead, sports analysts predict that a team needs at least 16 points, which translates to 8 wins out of 14 matches, to secure a playoff spot. Fans are eagerly waiting to see if RCB, currently at #7 with 6 points, can turn their season around, needing to win at least 5 of their remaining 7 games.
normalised: Looking ahead, sports analysts predict that a team needs at least sixteen points, which translates to eight wins out of fourteen matches, to secure a playoff spot.
